titles.title: Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael (fols. 3ra-112rb) I-1) Homily by Timothy (Dumatewos), Patriarch of Alexandria for the 12th of Ḫǝdar (fols. 3ra-9ra); commemorative notice (fols. 9ra-10vb); two ʿarke-hymns (fols. 10vb-11ra); miracle (fols. 11ra-13ra) I-2) Homily by an anonymous author for the 12th of Taḫśaś (fols. 13ra-18va); commemorative notice (fols. 18va-19ra); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 19ra-rb); miracle (fols. 19rb-20vb) I-3) Homily [by Epiphanius, Metropolitan of Cyprus] for the 12th of Ṭǝrr (fols. 20vb-29vb); commemorative notice (fols. 29vb-30ra); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 30ra); miracle (fols. 30ra-31rb) I-4) Homily by an anonymous author for the 12th of Yäkkatit (fols. 31rb-34va); commemorative notice (fols. 34va-35ra); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 35ra); miracle (fols. 35ra-36va) I-5) Homily by [Severus] Patriarch of Antiochia for the 12th of Mäggabit (fols. 36va-51rb); commemorative notice (fol. 51rb-va); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 51va); miracle (fols. 51va-53va) I-6) Homily by [Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs] the Orthodox for the 12th of Miyazya (fols. 53va-57vb); commemorative notice (fols. 57vb-58rb); miracle (fols. 58rb-61rb) I-7) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, [Metropolitan] of Ethiopia for the 12th of Gǝnbot (fols. 61rb-63ra); commemorative notice (fol. 63ra-va); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 63va); miracle (fols. 63va-66rb) I-8) Homily by [Yoḥannǝs,] Metropolitan of ʾAksum (ʾAkwǝsǝm) [for Säne] (fols. 66rb-72va); commemorative notice (fols. 72va-79rb); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 79rb-va); miracle (fols. 79va-82ra) I-9) Homily [by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs] for the 12th of Ḥamle (fols. 82ra-86va); miracle (fols. 86va-88rb); commemorative notice (fols. 88rb-89ra); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 89ra) I-10) Homily by an anonymous author for the 12th of Näḥase (fols. 89ra-91vb); miracle (fols. 91vb-97rb); commemorative notice (fol. 97rb-va); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 97va-vb) I-11) Homily by an anonymous author for the 12th of Mäskäräm (fols. 97vb-101va); commemorative notice (fol. 101va-vb); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 101vb); miracle (fols. 101vb-104vb) I-12) Homily by an anonymous author for the 12th of Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 104vb-109va); commemorative notice (fols. 109va-110rb); ʿarke-hymn (fol. 110rb-va); miracle (fols. 110va-112rb)

originlink.xlink:title: Däbrä Sahәl Qәddus Mikaʾel Bet Mäḵaʿ / DSM

locationlink.xlink:title: Däbrä Sahәl Qәddus Mikaʾel Bet Mäḵaʿ / DSM

copyists.copyist: The following names are mentioned in the supplication formulas (inserted in the main hand): Gäbrä Dǝngǝl and Wälättä Krǝstos (fols. 10vb, 11rb, 13ra etc.), Zä-Wäldä Maryam and Wälättä Ṣadǝqan (fols. 18va, 31rb etc.), Täklä Yoḥannǝs and ʿAmdä Maryam (fols. 28ra, 35ra etc.).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn and shows traces of intensive use; many folios are stained with dirt and affected by humidity. The Ms. was resewn. The leather cover is detached from the front board and completely torn off from the back board (turn-ins are preserved) and spine; traces of leather are visible on the outer side of the back board. Tears amended on fols. 62, 63.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark-brown tooled leather (for the most part missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather cover is abraded.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes and tears are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 2; 2, stub after 1/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) – IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – X(8/fols. 75r-82v) – XI(8/fols. 83r-90v) – XII(8/fols. 91r-98v) – XIII(8/fols. 99r-106v) – XIV(8/fols. 107r-112v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; names of the protagonist and of the angel Gäbrǝʾel (fols. 89rb, 99va-100ra, 107rb, 107vb, 109rb); names of the donors; words addressing the reader on fols. 11rb, 22ra; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
Several groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I (alternating with black lines); two or three initial lines in the incipit of sections (homilies), sometimes alternating with black lines (e.g., fols. 61rb, 89ra, 97vb); one or two initial lines of subsections (miracles and commemorative notices); the first word in the incipit of subsections (hymns), i.e. sälam "salutation".

otherdetails.otherdetail: Text I-6 does not include an ʾarke-hymn.

extras.extra: - Omitted letters and words are inserted interlineally: e.g., fols. 4ra, 7vb, 9vb, 11ra, 23va, 38rb, 40va, 68ra, 87ra, 103ra. - Faded note in pencil on fol. 112v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months written in the upper margin, in simple frames: ዘታኅሣሥ: fol. 13ra ዘጥር: fol. 20vb, in red ዘየካቲት: fol. 31rb, in red ዘመጋቢት: fol. 36va ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 53va ዘግንቦት: fol. 61rb ዘሰኔ: fol. 66rb, in red ዘሐምሌ: fol. 82ra ነሃሤ: fol. 89ra, in pen ዘመስከረም: fol. 97vb ዘጥቅምት: fol. 104vb, in red.

frames.frame: Fol. 3r (incipit page Text I): coloured (red, black) ornamental band with one central pendant reaching the bottom of the page; interlaces.
